DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of intranasal fentanyl spray in cancer patients over four weeks, especially during cancer-related breakthrough pain (BTP) attacks. The fentanyl spray was applied into the nose by a metered-spray device. The study was to provide further data on pharmacoeconomic efficiency of intranasal fentanyl spray.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Tolerability of Intranasal Fentanyl Spray for the Treatment of Breakthrough Pain in Cancer Patients Older Than 18 Years
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: decision to start treatment with intranasal fentanyl spray written informed consent Exclusion criteria: criteria as defined in the Summary of Product Characteristics (Fachinformation Chapter 4.3)
